name: The Block
title: Utf8b8jutw Bitcoin Whipsaws Amid Lummis
text:
Synopsis
Bitcoin experienced significant price volatility driven by political statements and potential regulatory developments, with key crypto-friendly politicians signaling continued support for the cryptocurrency ecosystem.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin briefly spiked to $106,000 following Senator Cynthia Lummis's announcement of chairing the Senate Banking Committee's new digital asset subcommittee
- Lummis previously introduced a draft bill proposing a "Bitcoin Purchase Program" to buy 200,000 BTC annually over five years
- President Trump reiterated his stance that the US will be the "world capital of AI and crypto" during a World Economic Forum address
- Changpeng "CZ" Zhao is returning to an active role in YZi Labs (rebranded from Binance Labs), focusing on investments beyond crypto including biotech and AI
- Bitwise filed a registration for a Dogecoin ETF entity in Delaware, signaling potential mainstream financial product expansion for the memecoin
- Jump Trading sued a former engineer for allegedly breaching a non-compete agreement by launching a rival blockchain venture
- Ledger co-founder David Balland was kidnapped and subsequently freed in a police operation
